section.title: openedx.features.discounts.applicability module
section.paragraph: Contains code related to computing discount percentage and discount applicability.

WARNING: Keep in mind that the code in this file only applies to discounts controlled in the lms like the first purchase offer, not other discounts like coupons or enterprise/program offers configured in ecommerce.

desc_content.paragraph: Check all the business logic about whether this combination of user and course can receive a discount.
Check whether this combination of user and course can receive the streak discount.
Get the configured discount amount.
Returns the date when the discount expires for the user. Returns none if the user is not enrolled.
Bases: AppConfig
Bases: StackedConfigurationModel
A ConfigurationModel to configure the discount percentage for the first purchase discount
Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist
Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

section.title: openedx.features.discounts.utils module
section.paragraph: Utility functions for working with discounts and discounted pricing.

definition_list_item.term: Return a formatted price, including a struck-out original price if a discount applies, and also

definition.paragraph: whether a discount was applied, as the tuple (formatted_price, has_discount).

desc_content.paragraph: Create a dictionary of information about the current discount offer.
Used by serializers to pass onto frontends and by the LMS locally to generate HTML for template rendering.
Returns a dictionary of data, or None if no offer is applicable.
A wrapper that prepends the First Purchase Discount banner if the user hasn’t upgraded yet.

section.title: openedx.features.discounts.views module
section.paragraph: The Discount API Views should return information about discounts that apply to the user and course.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: DeveloperErrorViewMixin, APIView

block_quote.paragraph: Request discount information for a user and course

definition_list_item.term: Body consists of the following fields:

definition.paragraph: whether the user can receive a discount for this course
the jwt with user information and discount information
The course key for which the discount should be applied

list_item.paragraph: 401 if there is no user signed in.

desc_content.paragraph: Return the discount percent, if the user has appropriate permissions.
Bases: DeveloperErrorViewMixin, APIView
DO NOT USE

This should not be used for anything other than getting the course/user discount information from ecommerce after payment in order to build an order. We plan to build orders before payment in this ticket: REV-692, at which point, this endpoint will no longer be necessary and should be removed.

block_quote.paragraph: Request discount information for a user and course

definition_list_item.term: Body consists of the following fields:

definition.paragraph: whether the user can receive a discount for this course
the jwt with user information and discount information
The course key for which the discount should be applied
The user id for which the discount should be applied

desc_content.paragraph: Return the discount percent, if the user has appropriate permissions.

section.title: Module contents
section.paragraph: Discounts are determined by a combination of user and course, and have a one to one relationship with the enrollment (if already enrolled) or a join table of user and course. They are determined in LMS, because all of the data for the business rules exists here. Discount rules are meant to be permanent.
